Fields.DialogueText: It's a beautiful day, don't you agree, Capitaine? Seems like the perfect day for adventure!
I'm not sure it's really an adventure. We're just on patrol right now.
Patrol? That's all we've got planned for the day?

Fields.MenuText: We've had this conversation, Audacieux. Were you not paying attention?
I could've sworn we went over this before...
You sound bored. Looking for a little excitement?

Fields.DialogueText: Honestly? I stopped listening after you said "Morganas." Figured I'd be better off preparing for the action.
Did we? It must've gotten too boring for me to actually pay attention.
Ya! Can you blame me after our last adventure? That was exciting!
Are we really stuck with patrol? There's nothing more... exciting or dangerous that we could do?
Not every assignment can be an adrenaline-packed adventure.
*ALARM*
You were saying?
I think I was getting to "Be careful what you wish for."
@BATTLE
Why exactly are we stuck running patrol, Capitaine? Don't the INPF know that I'm- I mean, we're the best they've got?
Honestly? After a turncoat almost got valuable intel to the Morganas on our watch... We're kind of in the doghouse right now.
What? But we got the plans back, and we even destroyed a bunch of Morganas in the process!

Fields.MenuText: We still lost them in the first place. We screwed up.
I agree with you, but they see things differently.
If anything, they should be giving us a commendation of some kind.

Fields.DialogueText: We didn't screw up. O'Brien screwed up.
Well, they're stupid then. They should see things our way!
Ooh, a commendation? You think they might really do that? I could use a commendation.
So we're just supposed to keep patrolling forever and ever until they come to their senses?
For now? Yeah. We shouldn't make them any angrier than they already are.
Ugh, I am not okay with this.
I didn't think you would be.
@BATTLE
I'm even less okay with Morganas.
*ALARM*
Um, Audacieux - what's with the massive hat?
It's a conversation starter. Your asking that question just means it's working.
Ah, you're just looking for more attention?
Ya. Always. Plus, it has a pretty regal look to it, doesn't it?

Fields.MenuText: I suppose it looks kind of like something royalty would wear.
You might be catching my eye, but I just hope you're not being made into a bigger target for the Morganas.
You're certainly pulling it off.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course it is. It's massive. It basically as big as I am. What could be more regal?
I stopped listening when you said I was catching your eye. Mission accomplished.
Really? You think so? Maybe I'll add it to my regular rotation of outfits.
That's got to be the craziest thing I've seen you wear yet.
Oh, please. You should see what I've got in my closet.
I'm sure I'd be surprised.
You will be. What are you doing now? In the mood to be surprised?
*ALARM*
I don't know, are you?
That's not exactly the surprise I had in mind. But I'll take it!
@BATTLE
Capitaine! Brav eo an amzer! I've been looking for you all over.
Looking for me? For what?
Well, I wanted to show you my room. Maybe get your advice on a few outfits.

Fields.MenuText: You want my advice on your outfits?
I'm a little busy. Can this wait until later?
Sounds like fun.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't sound so shocked. I value your opinion.
I mean... I suppose it can, but I'd really rather not put it off for too long.
Doesn't it? Let's hurry, then. My room's nearby.
Come on, Capitaine, don't make me drag you away.
All right, you win. Let's go to your room.
Ya! That's what I want to hear.
Just remember, we can't spend all day in there. We've still got work to do.
It's just patrol. It's hardly important.
*ALARM*
Sounds pretty important to me.
Oh, I suppose.
@BATTLE
So, what do you think? How did I look?
That was an outfit? It looked more like underwear.
Well, every outfit has to start somewhere. But answer the question! Did it look good?

Fields.MenuText: I think it looks like a great start.
I'm... getting a little uncomfortable here. I'm not sure what you want me to say.
Honestly, I'm not a fan. I'd probably take 'em off.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? Well, yeah, I think you're right. Now let's build onto this.
Just say what you want to say. I always appreciate your honesty, Capitaine.
Oooh? Really, Capitaine. I didn't expect you to be so bold. I like it!
*ALARM*
Hold that thought. We've got trouble.
Morganas? Now? Things were just getting good!
What do you mean, "getting good?"
Ugh, it doesn't matter now. At least I can destroy them.
@BATTLE
Audacieux, have you seen those reports I ordered?
Oh, you mean those things you thought were more important than my kill count?

Fields.MenuText: Not more important. Just a different kind of important.
Exactly, and now I can't find them!
Are you angry with me or something?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm still the most important then?
You actually think they're more important than me? That's cold, Capitaine.
Nann, I suppose I'm just in a bad mood in general.
So... You haven't seen them?
Calm down, Capitaine. They're right here.
Great. I wasn't looking forward to doing paperwork about lost paperwork.
Wait, these aren't the reports I was looking for...
No, they're better. Instead of garbage about previous battles, that report tells us where we can find more Morganas to destroy.
Yeah, but I can't send this data to Command to show our progress.
What better way to show progress than by blowing up the enemy?
That's not how this works, Audacieux.
Ugh, fine. Go look for your more important reports. I'll just go wait for the Morganas to find us.
... I wasn't saying I *like* how it works.
@BATTLE
Like I said, a different kind of important.
Ah! Oh, Capitaine, you snuck up on me! I wasn't expecting to see you here.
Sorry, but you know I like to patrol the ship around this time.
I feel so vulnerable. I was tanning and now you're here. And you can see... everything.
Not for the first time.
I feel like your eyes are boring into me. Penetrating me to my core!

Fields.MenuText: Boring into... I'm not looking directly at you!
Vulnerable? You usually don't care about people looking at you.
Um... You're making me sound like a predator or something.

Fields.DialogueText: Nann, don't! I mean... You can look if you want to. I can't stop you.
Oh, well, that's true. But you're different. I guess I'm starting to pick up on your discomfort.
Nann... Nann, you would never take advantage. It is what makes you both honorable and admirable.
Uh, Audacieux, you're acting pretty strange. What's going on?
Am I? I was just thinking the same about you.
What do you mean?
*ALARM*
We don't have time to talk about this. Go put something on and let's get to battle.
@BATTLE
There are Morgana ships bearing down on us, Capitaine!
@BATTLE
How did we not see those Morganas coming?
I was... a little distracted. I was trying to... to do something else.
What was so important?
It's nothing.

Fields.MenuText: It's not nothing. This is war. Any distraction could lead to disaster!
You should be able to tell me anything by now, Audacieux.
It's okay, I'm not mad. I just don't want this to happen again.

Fields.DialogueText: I know that! I just... I was focused on something else.
I'd tell you, but it's just... really embarrassing.
You're really not mad? You're too kind, Capitaine.
I promise it won't happen again.
You're really not going to tell me what was so distracting?
Nann. Not yet. I just... I need to work up the courage.
The courage?
Grr! This is harder than you think! You don't know what you're asking!
Okay, calm down. I'll give you time. You know where to find me.
Ya, I know. Give me a minute or two... Maybe a day... or two.
I feel sorry for them. They don't know who they've chosen to mess with!
Audacieux?
Are you not talking to me now?
Mmmm...
Oh, come on, you won't even look at me?
I'm not ready yet!

Fields.MenuText: Are you blushing?
Ready for what?
Ow! My poor ears!

Fields.DialogueText: Nann! You're blushing!
Shut up!
Oh, I'm so sorry, Capitaine, I didn't mean to shout so loud!
Okay, you clearly need more space. I think I'll give you a wide berth until you're ready to talk.
Okay... I...
That's the last thing I want.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
... Second to last.
*KNOCK*
Capitaine! I'm ready now! I have something to say to you.

Fields.MenuText: That's great. I'm all ears.
You've certainly kept me waiting. I almost forgot you existed.
You look tense. Are you okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, I don't know where to start. Give me a second.
What are you, a dog? It hasn't been that long since you've seen me.
I'm just nervous. I don't usually open up like this.
You're on the few people I trust, Capitaine. That means something. But I realized that I don't know a lot about you...
I understand. Your trust means a lot, Audacieux.
So I think... I think we should get to know each other a little better.
What?
The more we're able to do that, the easier it is for you to know how I work. What do you think?
I think that's a great idea. I know how stepping outside of your comfort zone and trusting someone can leave you feeling vulnerable.
Really?
Yes... I like the sound of that. I know how impatient routine patrols make you.
Heh... Well, you're not wrong, Capitaine. That is part of what I was-
*ALARM*
Gah! They have the worst timing!
Let's table this discussion. We just have to defeat the Morganas. Then we can come up with something to do.
That sounds... wait, all the Morganas or just these ones?
That's the question, isn't it?
@BATTLE
Well, this is new for me. I think it will help us to bond more if we spend time together and get to know each other.
... Come again?
Command has the right to know how best to put you to use, and I'll pay close attention to how you operate.
This is absolutely lovely, Capitaine. How did you know my favorite dish was La Lotte à l'Armoricaine?
You must've mentioned it before.
Really? I don't remember. I also didn't know that you could cook so well.

Fields.MenuText: I may have asked around a little.
I'm just a really good listener. You should quiz me some time.
I learned as much as I could about my Belle when I was first given this command.

Fields.DialogueText: A little? I overheard you interrogating the entire crew to gain information about me.
Ooh, be careful what you ask for, Capitaine. A quiz about me actually sounds pretty fun.
Well, this meal has just been so perfect. I'm actually having an enjoyable time.
I'm really flattered by all the work you put into this, Capitaine.
I have to agree, it's been lovely. I was honestly expecting a Morgana to inter-
Don't even say it! We wouldn't want to give them any ideas, would we?
You're right. Let's not even put the idea out there.
*ALARM*
Too late. Look what you did.
Duty calls. At least we were able to finish dinner. Let's go.
I'm right behind you.
I was just really looking forward to dessert...
@BATTLE
Audacieux, I have some news.
Oh? Did you find out what my favorite dessert is, as well? I was thinking-
No, uh, actually... We've been given an assignment.
An assignment? Well, it's about time they got over our little mishap and realized we're the best they've got.
About that... I was told that this is a second chance for us. I was also warned that it's our final chance.
A final chance? What does that even mean?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know. I was too afraid to ask.
If I had to guess? Execution.
I hope they were just being dramatic, but who knows?

Fields.DialogueText: You're too afraid for your own good sometimes.
Execution!? They wouldn't kill us for something like that. Would they?
Yeah. They were probably being dramatic. Because that's so like them.
It doesn't matter what they meant, because we're not going to fail this mission. Right?
Right.
Now can we talk about what's really important? I think-
We've got more important things to concern ourselves with.
*ALARM*
We clearly have different priorities.
@BATTLE
What are you up to in here, Capitaine?
Just figuring out our strategy for our new assignment. We can't go in blind.
Oh, with eyes like yours, I'm sure we'll see them coming from miles away.

Fields.MenuText: Uh, thanks?
You're right. I do have pretty great eyesight.
Seeing them will not matter if we don't have a plan to deal with them.

Fields.DialogueText: "Uh, thanks?" That's how you react to such a great compliment? You're supposed to say something nice about me now.
Exactly. Now use those terrific eyes and focus on what's really important.
Well, we deal with them like everything else. Artillery. Now that we've got that figured out, let's talk about something more fun.
You know, Audacieux, I really have to figure this stuff out. This is our final chance, remember?
You're worrying too much about this. I just want to help you take a load off. We won't have any issues taking care of this new mission.
You don't even know what our new mission is.
What?
I haven't had a chance to fill you in on the details yet, and you haven't asked.
Well, I don't have quite the one-track mind you think I do. I've also been meaning to-
*ALARM*
Focus on these Morganas?
I can focus on more than one thing.
Prove it.
@BATTLE
Capitaine! I've planned everything out to the last detail!
Really? I'm impressed. Let me see.
Here you go. You'll see I have us starting the day with some light shopping. I can't get too far from the ship, but we can browse through the harbor. Then we-
Wait. What is this?
I planned a day of activities so that we can continue to get to know each other better. Remember? We're supposed to be bonding. What else would I be talking about?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe the mission we're on.
I don't know why I expected anything else.
Honestly, I think you are trying too hard. Have a little patience, Audacieux.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, that thing? I figured you'd already finished all that planning. I'm the muscle.
Me neither. I've got my priorities well in hand.
Patience? I don't understand what you mean about trying too hard.
So, when do you think you'll have a day off? We'll need a whole day off to fit in everything I've got planned, but it'll be worth it.
I don't know, Audacieux. I do know I'm not going to have any days off until we finish this mission. Which is why I really need you to start focusing on that.
I am. But I'm also focused on us!
Okay, look. I think you're getting distracted from what's really important. I think you need to rethink your priorities and concentrate on this mission.
I hear you loud and clear. And to prove it, I'll run the assembly tomorrow. I understand you've got some plans to finish up.
You don't want to help?
Call it meeting you halfway, Capitaine. I'll focus on shipboard matters and sign off on whatever you put in front of me. You know me best, after all.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Curiouser and curiouser... Maybe she really is getting the hint.
*ALARM*
Audacieux!? Where are the Morganas? We weren't supposed to encounter them until-
Surprise! Welcome to our next activity! I needed to get you out of that office of yours. You've had your head buried in those plans for so long.
So this is all some sort of ambush?
Not a very flattering name, but I suppose it fits.

Fields.MenuText: That's... sweet, actually. Too sweet. As in so sweet that you spit it out.
You've gone way too far, Audacieux.
I'm still confused. Are we fighting Morganas or not?

Fields.DialogueText: Ya, I know! I'm so thoughtful, right?
Oh, shucks. I'd go to the end of the world for you, Capitaine.
Nann, you're just spending some quality time with your favorite Belle.
I thought we talked about this, Audacieux. We need to focus on our assignment. We don't have time to be messing around like this.
I'm not messing around, Capitaine. I briefed the crew during assembly while you were finishing up our battle plans. You wanted me to focus on what was most important, right?
I agree, but our personal relationship is not as important as making sure we aren't disbanded, or whatever the INPF has in store for us if we fail.
We'll make the INPF see reason when it comes to my missions, I have no doubt about that. But my plans require a more personal touch. I'm just acting rationally.
Frankly, right now you are acting like a spoiled brat. Creating false alarms-
*ALARM*
Turn that off! I'm already here.
Nann, that's not me. I instructed the crew to respond to the second one.
I'll give you this, Audacieux. You really do think things through.
Don't I always?
You're certainly making it safer for you to do... whatever it is you're trying to accomplish.
@BATTLE
Grr! How haven't I made that clear?
She's in here, Captain. I apologize for my part in this.
Not necessary. I know how she can get when she wants something. You're dismissed.
Sir.
How's it going, Audacieux?
So much better now.
I see you set a table for two.
Well, I get hungry when I'm impatient. And you didn't exactly hide the wine.

Fields.MenuText: You got me there. Next time I'll hide it.
I didn't expect you, or anyone, to try and drink all of it.
Or maybe you're just a really good detective.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! And I'll help! I know all of the good hiding places. I mean, I am the ship after all.
Always expect the unexpected. Oh, that's pretty good. Who said that? Did I say that?
Oh? I'm a detective? I thought I was a warship? Is that what I've been doing wrong?
Well, the filet mignon should absorb it. Want to tell me what fit of pique drove you to devour two three-course meals?
My capitaine thinks I'm a brat. Oh, but don't tell them, okay? I'm mad at them now. We can't let them know how sad they made me.
I... I promise I won't tell.
Thanks, Capitaine. You're the best. That's why I l... oh, dear. Moving is difficult now.
Okay... Come on, let's get you up to your room. Looks like you need to lay down.
Ya, I'd like some bedtime-sleep-rest.
*ALARM*
Oh, is that the Morgana alarm!?
Probably, yeah. But you're not really-
I can be stuffed later! We need to hurry and blow them up! Let's go!
@BATTLE
But there's food for zero. And wine for... yep, zero.
Spent all my spare time filling it up.
Oh, there she is. Good morning, Audacieux.
It's certainly a morning.
What's that you're drinking?
Herbal remedy for headaches.

Fields.MenuText: Drank a little too much?
I hope you're not getting sick.
Blech, sounds yucky.

Fields.DialogueText: That is none of your business, but we may need to restock on a few choice beverages.
I'm not. I drink stuff like this to avoid getting sick.
Medicine isn't supposed to taste good. The worse it tastes, the better it is.
Anyway, I was just stopping by to see if you needed any help strategizing or anything.
Maybe when you're feeling a little better.
I feel perfectly fine. Let me help.
*ALARM*
Are you feeling fine enough to handle some Morganas?
You mean this horrible ringing isn't just in my head? Ya, let's go.
@BATTLE
Feeling better, Audacieux?
Much, actually. And... I wanted to apologize.
Apologize? Let me sit down. This feels like finding a four-leaf clover or something.
Looking back, I can see now that I wasn't exactly being helpful. I wasn't focused on the right matter. I'm sorry.

Fields.MenuText: Apology accepted. I can't stay mad at you.
Just prove you're really sorry through your actions from now on, okay?
You don't need to apologize. If there wasn't a looming threat, I'd have been just as focused on it as you were. But there's a time and place for everything.

Fields.DialogueText: Trugarez, Capitaine. And that's good to know.
I will. I'm now one hundred percent focused on this new mission.
You're very sweet, Capitaine. You really need to stop being so sweet.
Okay. I think to start out, it would probably be a good idea to know what our mission is.
I agree. Remember that giant Morgana that chased us out of their territory before?
The one that almost swallowed us whole? The one that we only beat with the help of the INPF?
That's the one. They believe that one of those big guys has been wreaking havoc along a coast. We've been sent to deal with it, because we have some experience.
Ya, experience running from it. If we'd had more practice against nastier foes...
Now you see why I've been so focused on planning for this fight.
Hmm... It looks like you've been trying to give me what I want after all. Can't argue with that.
@BATTLE
It looks even bigger than I remember.
Ya... This... We've got this. We can do anything together.
You're right. We're the best of the best, right?
Capitaine?
Yes?
I know I shouldn't be thinking about stuff like this, but... I wanted to give you my locket, for luck.

Fields.MenuText: I've seen this, but I've never seen you wear it. It looks old.
I would be honored to keep your locket. Are you sure.
I will put it on right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya, I've had it for as long as I can remember. Keep it close?
Ya, I'm certain. It will bring you luck and keep you safe.
You tucked it inside next to your heart. It's not exactly regulation.
*BOOM*
Looks like it noticed us. I hope you have enough luck as well.
Me too. After we take this thing down... we're planning our day trip!
I thought you were going to focus on the mission at hand.
I've never been more focused, sir. Here, I'll prove it.
@BATTLE
This isn't going well.
We can still handle this. It's taken a few hits too. We just need to keep up the assault... Oh no!
What is it?
Reinforcements are coming. I can sense them on the way.

Fields.MenuText: We have to retreat.
Still confident we can win?
A few reinforcements? Piece of cake.

Fields.DialogueText: You're making a lot of sense, but...
Nann... I wish I was, but...
My, Capitaine, but you wear confidence well!
We can do this. We have to beat these junk heaps.
Uh, Audacieux... That looks like a whole lot of reinforcements.
Doesn't matter. We have to do this. This is our last chance, remember?
If we die here we can't go on that shopping trip.
Stop making me smile! I hate it when you're right!
So we need to focus on evading the reinforcements and getting out of here.
If we turn around now, we should be able to get to safety before most of the Morganas arrive.
There are still more reinforcements coming?
Oh, did I not mention that?
We're definitely making the right decision.
@BATTLE
It's been rough out here. But the important thing is that we're still alive.
No, the important thing is getting back out there, finding that monster, and finishing her off.
Take a breath, Audacieux. There's no need to rush back into battle.
Ya, there is! You were right about priorities, Capitaine. I have been too focused on the small things, on getting to know you better, and forgot the damage that beast can do!

Fields.MenuText: It's all right. You're focused on the right thing now.
You do have a point. But you also need to know that nothing could shatter the bond that we do have.
Don't be ridiculous. I'm glad that you realize the consequences now, but rushing to get ourselves killed helps no one.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya, I am. I have you to thank for that, Capitaine.
I'm glad to hear that. So let's kick this repair into overdrive. I'll show you that your faith in me is not misplaced!
Did you just call me ridiculous? No one else would ever be able to get away with calling me that.
Audacieux, I want to apologize for calling you a brat. You aren't.  I know how much you care about people, the crew... and me.
I was hurt at first, but...
Yeah. That's exactly it. "Final chance." I'm afraid that means they'll separate us... or worse. They could even decommission you.
I didn't see that at first. I was too focused on what I wanted to see the bigger picture.
We might need to work on our communication skills.
There'll be time for that. After we obliterate these Morganas and finish this mission.
Sounds good to me.
@BATTLE
You've been doing all this, working so hard... because you are afraid that the INFP will separate us, aren't you?
There's the ugly, oversized beast!
It doesn't look like it's completely recovered.
See? I was right to get us back out here so quickly!

Fields.MenuText: I hate to admit it, but it looks like you actually know what you're talking about sometimes.
Aren't you always right?
Don't be so sure of yourself. Wait until we actually win before you start bragging.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you very mu... Hey, what do you mean by sometimes?
Well, ya, but I like hearing you admit it.
Pft. We've got this fight in the bag.
Come on! It's time to finish this!
Wait a minute. This seems too easy. Are you sensing any other Morganas in the area?
If I was sensing other Morganas I'd have... Wait... Ya, there might be more of them. A lot more of them.
Where?
All around us.
It's a trap!
It's too late to run. This might be a little tougher than we thought.
But we can still handle it, right? Together.
Together.
@BATTLE
Brace yourself, Capitaine. We are about to take a major hit.
@BATTLE
We did it... I can't believe we did it!
That's right, we did it!
Whoa, Audacieux! That maneuver you pulled to avoid that direct hit... Are you all right?
I am so fine that I am ready to plan our day off now.

Fields.MenuText: You never give up, do you?
I'd be happy to. Where would you like to go?
Now? We literally just beat that massive Morgana. I think I still have some of it in my hair.

Fields.DialogueText: Why would I do that? Especially when I am always right!
Fantastic, because I've put a lot of thought into this. I've got high expectations.
And you've never looked more attractive. I think you should keep it there. It's a nice accessory.
Okay, we can talk more about what we're going to do after we've arrived at port. We used a lot of supplies dealing with this Morgana.
Fine, I suppose you have a point. Fair warning, though: I might not be able to wait until then.
But you'll try?
For you? Of course.
You should see the enemy!
Something on your mind, Audacieux?
I'm not... It occurred to me that... I never asked if you wanted to do any of the activities, did I? I just told you. Am I forcing you into this?

Fields.MenuText: A little bit, but I like that. I'm used to taking orders.
Not at all. I don't do anything that I don't want to.
Um... I'm not sure how to answer that.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm forcing you, but you like it? What does that even mean?
Really? Because... I've been thinking and... haven't I been pretty forceful?
Oh, great. That means I am. I knew it!
Capitaine, you're one of the few people I really trust. So please be honest: do you actually want to go with me today?
Where is all this coming from?
Well, I realized I've been focused so much on what I want, and... I suppose this mission has made me mature a little. I realize just how unhelpful and annoying I've been lately.
I wouldn't blame you if you didn't like me anymore, and you were just humoring me out of obligation.
Okay, that's ridiculous. Even for you.
Hey!
Okay, I know you love arguing, and you're not very good at letting things go, but what I'm about to say, I need you to accept without any argument. Okay?
Okay...
If I didn't care about you, if I didn't like you, if you didn't matter, I wouldn't have been putting so much work into making sure this mission succeeded and moved you off Command's naughty list.
But-
No arguing. Accept it... Or don't.
So, what are you doing tomorrow?
Well, I'm going shopping and to play tourist. Maybe you would like to join me.
I would, Capitaine. But... I will make sure we get there first.
@BATTLE
I thought we were going to town once we reached port?
Well, Capitaine, we will! But first, since you learned to cook my favorite dish, I learned to cook your favorite dessert.

Fields.MenuText: Oh really? Where did you get the rum to make the cake?
Babas au Rhum! How did you know it was my favorite?
So this is why you disappeared when we restocked.

Fields.DialogueText: It seems that not all of certain beverages were consumed on the night that we will never speak of again.
You are not the only one who can ask questions. So, Capitaine, this is my first time baking this. Are you feeling adventurous?
Perhaps I have a future in covert operations as well!
Okay... I'm diving in.
Why, Capitaine... You seem nervous. Do you not trust me after all?
It was a joke. Of course I trust you and your cooking... Mostly.
I hope so.... Wait, what do you mean by "mostly?"
I worked really hard on this. It wasn't easy to make, you know!
I know, and I appreciate the effort. More than you will ever know.
Good. I like doing things that make you happy.
